hackathon-description-text: : Develop community models and technology tools to improve access to justice for veterans and those who aim to support them.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Chair of the ABA Presidential Commission on the Future of Legal Services
Organizer @ Women in Tech Houston, Independent Content Strategist

hackathon-rules:
Please read our Code of Conduct 
. 
RULES

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: The 1st place team receives a $5,500.00 cash prize.
The 2nd place team receives a $2,500.00 cash prize.
The 3rd place team receives a $1,500.00 cash prize.
The 4th place team receives a $500.00 cash prize.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=720 S Michigan Ave, Chicago, IL 60605, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: How useful is the tool to the veteran community? How well does this solution address the target problem?
How close to “product” or "completion" has the hack been over the time period allotted to the team? Was the amount of work done during the hackathon significant?
Given the constraints of the hackathon, how unique & interesting is the idea?
Was the purpose of the tool adequately conveyed during the presentation of the prototype?

hackathon-location-address: 720 S Michigan Ave, Chicago, IL 60605, USA
